description: From Middle English moderately, moderatelye, moderatliche, moderatly, modiratli; equivalent to moderate +â€Ž -ly.

adverbs.description: moderately (comparative more moderately, superlative most moderately)

examples: During the debate, they disagreed plainly, but moderately.

entries.meaning: To a moderate extent or degree.
examples: They were at least moderately happy with their bonuses.
